lines.gurmukhi: jYsy guAwr gwien crwvq jqn bn Kyq n prq sbY crq AGwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Guaar Gaain Charaavat Jatan Bana , Khayt N Parat Sabai Charat Aghaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as cowherd grazer grazes his cows very attentively in the jungle and does not let them wander into some fields, and they graze to their satisfaction.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwjw Drm srUp rwjnIq ibKY qw ky dys prjw bsq suK pwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Raajaa Dharam Saroop Raajaneet Bikhai , Taa Kay Days Parajaa Basat Soukh Paai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a king who is righteous and just, his subjects live in peace and prosperity.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy hoq Kyvt cyqMin swvDwn jw mY lwgY inribGn bohQ pwir jwie kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Hot Khayvat Chaytanni Saavadhaan Jaa Mai , Laagai Nirabighan Bohad Paari Jaai Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a sailor is very alert and conscious of his duties, that ship touches the yonder shore without any adverse happenings.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur aunmn mgn bHm joq jIvn mukiq krY isK smJwie kY ]418]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Ounaman Magan Braham Jota , Jeevan Moukati Karai Sikh Samajhaai Kai ?418?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the True Guru who has merged with the Light divine of the Lord, like warp and weft of a cloth, alone can make a disciple living emancipated with His teachings.  (418)
